output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.

The setPrices function has a global random variable, which is susceptible to the RAND_BASE problem, allowing attackers. The RAND_BASE problem occurs when a random value is used to initialize a data structure, such as a hash or a tree, which can be arbitrarily constructed and used to create a reliable, reproducible vulnerability.
